title: Hong Kong stock exchange won't rule out bids for other stock exchanges
text:
Hong Kong’s stock exchange has refused to rule out bidding for other stock exchanges after withdrawing a £32bn offer for its London rival earlier this week.

Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing (HKEX) is currently blocked from making a further bid for the London Stock Exchange (LSE) for the next six months under UK takeover rules.

In the meantime, LSE is pressing ahead with plan for a $27bn (£22bn) purchase of data provider Refinitiv. The acquisition would make any future takeover of the group more expensive and potentially beyond the reach of many prospective buyers.
